review: I've eaten here a few times and always have the spicy chicken sandwhich since it's so good. This time I went for a large salad and enjoyed it very much.   Plenty of food to fill any one.  Good burger joint, too.

Red robin has an amazing scenery inside. Televisions everywhere, many posters and other memorabilia from some of the greatest movies ever, including an American flag made of baseballs. There are also many memorable photographs throughout the course of history which is amazingly cool. It is an amazingly cool restaurant except for its attraction of little annoying children, however if you sit far away from them (because its a huge restaurant, along with outside seating) its not a problem. What is annoying though is the constant inflation of balloons at the front of the restaurant for these annoying children which is incredibly loud and obnoxious, so don't sit in the front if you don't want to hear this. And then you get A-hole parents who let their A-hole children pop the right section. What's also cool is that there is an ability to get burgers to go if in a rush. What's also great is that if you don't like what you see on the menu, you can customize a burger any way you like, but if you don't like mayo, you have to tell them not to put it on, otherwise they automatically slap it right on the sandwich. We got the onion ring tower to start, and it was fantastic. Great tasting dipping sauces with perfectly fried onion rings. It was fantastic. For dinner I got a burger with cheddar cheese, guacamole, and chili cooked well done on a sesame bun. It was an amazing burger. The chili was cooked to perfection and it was sooo delicious. The fries were also incredibly good. They had an amazing seasoning which just tasted delectable. The waiter did screw up our order originally by forgetting to place our order for the onion rings but this was fixed. I also recommend the red robin home made seasoning which is very tasty but if too much is added on, it won't taste very good. Overall a delicious restaurant but noise problems here and there. Recommended restaurant.

I like Red Robin, i've been here a few times, this time however i was a little annoyed. The waitress was pushing these new "pub burgers", the pictures of them looked good, i ordered a bacon-double. My wife ordered a regular burger w/ mushrooms. The pub burger (although a double) was about 30% smaller than the regular burgers. I didn't notice anything on the menu about them being smaller. It was very tasty but i'm a big guy and i was hungry.  All in all it was good but that aggravated me.

Really good experience here. The service was outstanding. Emily and Trina were excellent servers and the meals we had were delicious. The hostess ( don't know her name) was genuinely effective and asked what we had on our way out and how we liked it. That's good PR.

We came here around 2:30 on a Thursday afternoon just after Hurricane Sandy. They were unexpectedly packed with all of us driving from New Jersey to get gas. Despite clearly not being staffed as they would like for the unexpected crowd, they did an excellent job. Our server Marie brought us fries to munch on while we waited (which really wasn't even that long) and the manager was busily sweeping the floors.

Just stopped at this Red Robin for a quick break. The food was over priced for what we got. My daughter ordered a petite cheeseburger with fruit as a side. The burger was a tough thin patty. The fruit was a mushy mess... Not even edible.  All in all, not great. Ended up costing us over $40 for three of us. Probably wont go again.

I've always been a fan of Red Robin and their burgers and have only once been disappointed. Their burgers are very tasty and the steak fries are also pretty darn good. I got the gingerbread milkshake on my last visit and man is that one tasty way to celebrate the holiday season. I definitely recommend!

Username: Mr F G And Ms M S.
review: 3.5 Stars We got the cheeseburger with bottomless fries & the riblets with mac n' cheese. The burger was pretty good, juicy, & flavorful. The riblets was just decent. The mac n' cheese were pretty bland.  Generous portion! Great service!

It's been at least 5 years since my last Red Robin visit so I was game to stop in when we received a $25 gift certificate.  The place was empty, but we were greeted with a smile and quickly seated. The Staff:  Friendly!  Everyone was nice and eager to please without being too overbearing.   The Location:  This location has been here a bit but it felt brand new inside.  Open ceilings, big screen tvs, and a bright layout were all quite nice. The Food:  Now I remember why it's been 5 years since I've been here.  The Pretzel Bites were deep fried, chewy, and otherwise meh.  My spicy burger was spicy, but I was underwhelmed by the overall flavor, especially the beef.  Maybe my burger palate has evolved, or maybe I just picked the wrong burger.  Either way, I won't be rushing back for the food. Overall - 3 stars.  I can't knock it any lower because the location was spotless and the staff was superb.

They don't have these in NYC so I stopped into one with the fam on a trip to the Poconos.  All those dang commercials must have worked.  Well, I was pleasantly surprised.  Burger was actually pretty good, portion size was just right.  Service at this location was really good, servers were exceptionally polite and attentive.   I got the steakhouse and we had nachos which were far better than the ones in Mexican chains.  Kids were really happy with their milkshakes.  What was cool was also the tablet computer on a stand at every table which let you pay without getting your server.  Every chain restaurant should have this.  All in all, far exceeded my expectations for a chain.  Will definitely go back when I'm in an area with one of these.

An OK place for dinner.  We came here while staying at the Great Wolf Lodge up the road for an alternative place to eat.  While it's better than the Lodge's food, it's not as good as I had hoped.  Burgers are just OK.  Fries are the large steak fries (I do prefer the string kind).  Salads are large and seem OK.   The inside decor is always interesting.  Great pictures and memorabilia to look at.  They also have a mini-arcade for the kids as you walk in. Waitress was very nice.  I noticed this new electronic feature at the tables where you can play games or pay your bill.  I tried to play a game, only to find out that will cost you $1.99 each - extra.  Was kind of put off by that sneaky charge.
Server was very attentive and restaurant was clean. Food was piping hot when we got it and our drinks were constantly refilled. Great job Jamie!
Great restaurant. Good price. Best burgers ever and you can't go wrong with bottomless fries.

Stopped here on our way back from a race weekend in the Poconos. We ordered the typical burgers which were tasty, but I wasn't too thrilled with the level of salt in the guacamole on my burger and both my burger and my sister in laws burger came out with the bacon missing. I ended up scraping the guac off mine, it was pretty gross. Our server and the rest of the staff were very friendly, even after one of the babies dumped a huge glass of water on the floor after trying to maneuver a straw on her own. The company of family and the fact that my niece was so thrilled by the big red robin statue she giggled and pointed the whole time made everything about this adventure perfect!!

Totally incompetent, especially if you have a gluten allergy. I call and ask if they have gluten free buns, they say yes, so I take the 40 minute drive because I'm excited. I walk in and ask the front if they have gluten free buns, just in case, and they say yes. I sit down and ask the waiter if they have gluten free buns, he says absolutely. I order and after 20 minutes, the GM comes out and tells me "we don't have any gluten buns". So not only do I waste a part of my day coming here but he doesn't even know what gluten free buns are. The GM of a chain restaurant doesn't know what gluten is, pretty incredible. I tell him that's very disappointing and that I'm leaving and he says "ok" and walks away. What a joke.

I'm not a big burger person so maybe that is why I am not a fan of Red Robin. I'm not sure but I am not really a fan of anything in there. The one good thing is the onion ring tower appetizer. Other than that not a fan of the food or the drinks.

I finally got to a Red Robin for the first time ever this past week.  I've always seen the reviews/pics on Yelp and everything looked pretty good.  I've had friends also tell me how great the burgers are.  I was all about coming here. My wife and I stopped in and we grabbed a couple of stools at the bar.  They have 10 beers on tap - mostly all domestics but I was pleasantly surprised to see they had Sam Adams Winter Lager on tap.  This is quickly becoming one of my favorite beers.  We ended up having our entire meal at the bar and the service was decent.  It could of have been a touch more attentive since there weren't many people at the bar but what can you do? The menu is actually pretty big - it's basically apps, burgers and different sandwiches but they have a ton to choose from.  My wife and I started out with an order of the Buffalo wings which came served over some chips.  I was actually pretty disappointed by the wings.  I've seen them in pictures on Yelp before and they always looked really good, but these wings were incredibly small.  There was barely any meat on them.  The chips were decent - definitely the first time I've ever had wings some over chips.  The other thing I found strange is that the wings weren't served with either blue cheese or ranch - we had to ask for some blue cheese.  They could have overlooked it but I'm not sure.  The blue cheese was actually very good - it was pretty nice and chunky - just the way I like it.  I'd probably pass on the wings again.  I did see someone eating nachos and they looked very good. For our meals, both my wife and I had their classic cheeseburger.  It was a good choice.  Red Robin does a couple of things with their burgers that I really like.  First, they actually cook it how you order it.  It's amazing how many places fail miserably at this.  They also serve the burgers with shredded lettuce, pickles and mayo.  Shredded lettuce is much better than your standard lettuce and it's amazing how much better pickles and mayo can make a burger taste.  I'm not totally positive but they could have had mustard on there, too, but I'm not positive.   The burger itself was on that very good to excellent border.  Like I said before, it was cooked perfectly, the toppings were great and it was constructed nicely (i.e. it was not falling apart as you ate it).  You can tell that they use a higher quality meat than some of the other chains.  I also added jalapenos to my burger and they gave the burger a nice kick.  They also weren't the canned jalapenos - these were the fresh ones.   Red Robin also offers never-ending or all you can eat steak fries.  I guess this is very appealing to some people but not me.  I'd rather you just give me a decent amount of fries from the start, but instead, they give you about 12 fries with your first order assuming you will probably keep ordering.  Fries were good but I wish they would have given me some more.  I guess that's the point of the all you can eat, but I didn't feel like waiting around for french fries. Overall, I liked this place.  There's actually another location down by me in NJ which I'll probably hit up the next time I'm in the mood for a Red Robin burger.  I was "meh" on their wings and the fry policy, but I really enjoyed the burger.  I don't see how you can do wrong with one of those.  If I was rating this place strictly on the burger, I'd easily go 4 stars.  The wings have to bring my rating down, though.  Oh well - I'll still be back.

I'm a huge fan of Red Robin and its burgers. I stopped by here after a day of snowboarding and a delicious burger with unlimited steak fries really hit the spot. The service is pretty attentive and friendly. Our food came out very quickly and they utilize today's technology by providing a tablet where you can order appetizers and drinks (not entrees), and you can also charge your bill with it.  As for the food, I got the Burnin' Love and it was great. It was spicy enough to enrich your eating experience and it doesn't leave you dying. I always add a bit of the Red Robin seasoning to my fries for that bonus flavoring.
Service slow, burger not so good, expensive- $13 for a cheeseburger/fries, quality below average. I would not visit this place again.

I would've given this place 5 stars if their burgers were a bit more flavorful but I have to say overall I had a great experience here.  -Options are endless (so are the sides like fries, sweet potato fries, steamed broccoli, cole slaw and salad!)  -Gluten free options! Including buns, fries and other sides (plus other healthy options) -Bacon, bacon and more bacon (sauces, toppings, sides) -personal screen at each table (great for the kids and adults) used for ordering apps, shakes, desserts and playing games -Great service! The fam and I will definitely be frequenting this establishment

Boy had it for a first time and said I had to try it. The burgers are made medium because they don't serve any quality lower (rarer) than medium. You could even skip appetizers because the unlimited fries, or any of the substitutions like salad and sweet potato fries, will keep you satisfied. I had the bacon avocado burger and boy had the prime chophouse. The chophouse was sweeter, and def a good pick. Great pit stop for dinner!

Great chicken sandwiches and great service. Love their bottomless steak fries. The only negative was that we got 2x bowls of clam chowder that was salty. Overall the restaurant was awesome. Good for kids.

Was to the red robin yesterday and it was pretty good.  Food was hot,  service was quick.  Checkout is electronic so no waiting for a waitress to come back with check or change.  Overall one of the better red robins ive been to.  Would go to again
We had a very friendly server named angel.  The restaurant was clean and service was fast.   I would come here again.  Its a burgers and fries place, and seems to be well run.

Love Red Robins and love this store but the only issue I have ever had here is that the pretzel bites never have enough salt. When you ask for extra salt it's still the paltry amount! It's a pretzel. Pretzels have salt Red Robin. This is the only constant issue. I guess as issues go it's miniscule. Otherwise great food...Yum!

Food was okay and being a burger joint I was expecting better burgers. Freckled lemon-aid was on point. Servers we all friendly and dancing around. Overall experience was good just next time I have to order a different burger and hopefully for a better outcome.

Stopped in here the day before thanksgiving for a quick meal while on the road. The service was quick because it was near closing time.  The floor was dirty. It looked like it hadn't been swept in days. One of the servers was very vocal about her want to go home, and they charged $2.49 for a cup of coffee.  This was my first time at a Red Robin, and I think it was also my last.

Potatoe soup delicious  Ordered chicken breast grilled mozzarella cheese on it  No salted fries  No lettuce no tomatoes no onions no pickles no bun  Came no bun all other things with it Does were salted  Everything took forever  Even bottomless regular fries

Was sat in the bartenders section.. Restaurant was busy.. Bartender was in the weeds.. So my wife and I suffered.. Service was horrible.. She couldn't get to us at all.. They need to staff the restaurant correctly.. Then the food comes out.. Fries and burgers were extremely salty.. And cold.. We were starving.. We ate.. Paid on their little machine and left.

Love, love, love their Burgers, and I'm a big fan of the Blue moon shakes. This location is dope but it's just what I expect at any Red Robin I visit.... Red Robin...uuuumm [Update- back in 2015 this was different and new. The more often you go the more if feels like a McDonald's visit...]
Pretzel Bites & Bottomless Fries. Service at this location was EXCELLENT, something most Red Robins have been lacking for a while now
Typical chain burger however the staff is ultra friendly. Jamie is an awesome server. Great place for a Saturday afternoon with the kids. Very accommodating

Ate here after we went biking in Lehigh gorge state park. We were seated immediately because it was already after the lunch time madness. The onion rings were delicious and the burgers good. I asked for sweet potato fries but they were soggy. service was fine and we'll probably go back because of the yummy onion rings-

My family and I stopped here on our way home to Ohio from New York. We were looking for something quick but good and tried here for the first time. The kids got the Mac & Cheese with fries and the wife and I got the Chicken Tender salad with grilled chicken. Since the salads looked pretty generous in size, we decided to split it. The waitress was great and had them prepared two separate salads with no problem, and the portions were still plenty for both of us. The atmosphere was clean, relaxed and friendly. All in all it was a nice pit stop with good service and food.

I've been to this location on many occasions and find the wait staff very friendly.  I love the fact you don't have to wait for your waiter and can order from the electronic machine on your table along with checking out.  Also like that they have some gf options.   Food is decent but I think they should offer more healthy options.  Although it's a chain restaurant, people are looking to stay healthy today.  Maybe some lettuce options and vegetarian meals.   The freckled lemonade is very good and you get free refills on them and fries.  The steak fries are good and they offer in gf as well!!  Place is clean but they could be a little Neater in the bathroom and fix the door that's been broken in the restaurant for at least 6 months.

Came here because it was the only place open late. We shouldve stayed and ate at the resort. burgers were ok, service was ok....nothing like the one in NY I frequent. Only 1 person in the party of 9 enjoyed their food.

This is my first time going to a red robin & I'm pleasantly surprised. We had good service good food and unlimited drinks and fries. The burgers where great I recommend everyone go to Red Robin at least one bit ankle sure you go to a stand alone store my wife told me the one attached to a mall on VA was terrible & so has many of my Anti red robin friends.

I love Red Robin but this location was not up to the standards I'm used to at New York red robins. It was filthy and the AC was on do high I was shivering the entire meal. The waitress did not come over at all to ask if we needed anything and took a long time to take our initial drink order. And the women's bathroom was absolutely disgusting and when I told the hostess on my way out she seemed confused and just said ok. Since there are a few other burger places within a minute or two drive, I'd highly recommend skipping this location.

Red Robin is just an okay fast food place. The chicken wasn't the best. They have many gourmet burgers varieties, so if you're into American food, this is the place for you. It was really cold inside. I mean how high can the A.C really be, 30 Farenheit? The sandwhich was great and the kid's menu was just fine. Not the best place for a fancy meet up you could say.

I don't usually have a problem when i got to Red Robin, but this visit left me nothing but disappointed. We arrived well after the lunch rush on a week day, and the place was empty. Still took the server 10 minutes just to come and take our drink order. If you're that busy, send a hostess. Took another hour to get food. The burgers were decent. Barely any onion on them, the guacamole was just as sparse. The fries were barely cooked, and only slightly warm. We wanted to order dessert, but were afraid it would have taken another 30 minutes. We won't be back.
The food was good.   Waitress was good.  Place was clean (incl. bathroom).

The wait staff, hostesses and managers are great but the food is just not good at this location.  Hard to go wrong with fries and they do!!! Do not order a burger with lettuce because the lettuce is always old.

Have not been to a Red Robin in years. Stopped in after Christmas shopping.  Place was busy but all of the servers were moving continuously among the restaurant. Our waitress was friendly and attentive. Drinks were ordered and they came right out. I ordered a burger with a egg on it and it came out exactly as I asked. Delish! My sister ordered the veggie burger and she said it was great. The only thing I didn't like was the electronic ordering tablet on the table. It was bright and I just turned it away from us. This Red Robin was clean, efficient, warm and friendly. Will go again.

This was our 2nd time at this red robin the bathrooms were dirty and our server did not listen to anything we ordered. We had to tell her twice what we want just to drink. I order water with a lot of lemons on the side. Guess what lemon was in my water and I only got half of one. My husband order a fried egg on his burger it was cooked over easy the white was not even done. Service absolutely suck this time and the time b4.

I visited here shortly after they opened for lunch. Place was empty and I always find the music WAY too loud. Service was prompt and friendly. I had the black and bleu burger which was a little dry even though it was cooked as ordered. The fries are always yummy and I love the bottomless root beer floats! OMG!! I'll go back just for that.

The food was excellent and our waitress Jackie M was so awesome. She really took care of us and consistently checked on us. She's really courteous and all around a really sweet person! She made us feel important.  The burgers were really really good! We will be back.

I want to give a High Five and a shout out to RedRobbin. Last time, I complained about terrible food  on Valentine's Day. Management read my review, followed up with me, forwarded it to the regional and branch managers, who all contacted me. Ultimately, concern addressed with offer of full refund or complimentary meals; we chose the latter because we love RedRobbin!

It gets 5 stars because it was excellent and exceeded expectations. The food was good, good service, good beer, and convenient check out tablets on the table. My expectations were not high and I left surprisingly satisied. We didn't need the bottomless fries or kids drinks, but they are free for anyone with a larger appetite.
Always a fan of this place.  Food is good and the servers are friendly.  I always stop by when I'm in the area.

Good food but what was even better was the staff!   The staff couldn't be nicer.    We had a very large party of 17 and they put us in three tables in close proximity.    We had some vegetarians and some with peanut allergies in our group.   The staff was so kind and literally bent over backwards to accommodate us.   Bravo to the great workers last night!

Stopped off here for dinner and were seated promptly.  The staff was very attentive and accommodating. We ordered the teryaki chicken burger and the beef burger. They were both awesome. The side order or sweet potato fries were a pretty darn good addition. This is diner food, burgers, fries, onion rings so we were delighted to find hummus on the appetizer menu. What a great surprise. The hummus was tasty and it came with carrots, celery, pepper and garlic bread. We will definitely order that again!
Everything is around $10, but I have to say that when we went the service was quick and friendly. They are very clean and I enjoy their turkey burger.

This time Red Robin was good...seems the last few times I ate here,  I was disappointed... today I ordered a gourmet classic cheeseburger with lettuce and tomatoes with Mayo and ketchup.  Side of fries with their campfire sauce...Plus a strawberry shake... My meal came to $14.39 I enjoyed it!

And the better experience was right here, when they first opened. Now, even the waitress said her grandma said it's not the same. Like everywhere, they give LESS for MORE. The quality is god awful. Trying Chillis next.

Very basic and just ok in a pinch. I had their crispy chicken with ramen bun which was kind of interesting. Others had salads which were fine. We ordered the pretzel bites with cheese. I've had better at other chains. So - if you are on a road trip and need to stop and get something quick - And don't felt like going to McDonalds - this might be a fine alternative.

I LOVE red robin-don't get me wrong. But the waitress I had last night was just not good. Went there for dinner last night passing through Pennsylvania. Walking in the service was fine, we were seated almost immediately. Our waitress, Anja (spelling may be wrong) came over and greeted us, got our drinks within like 5/10 minutes and we ordered an appetizer. We then ordered our meals, and everything came out fine but our waitress forgot about a few things we ordered. She came over, we asked for them, and 2 refills on our soda and she said okay. We see her walking around to her other tables, and we are still waiting. She then comes over and tells us the onion rings will be a few minutes. We then asked for the refills again and the ranch dressing we asked to come out with the meal. She said she forgot and would be right over. She comes over a couple minutes later with the ranch only and we just kind of gave her a look. Said thank you and still looked kind of confused. She then was like oh your drinks. After like 10 minutes we finally got our drinks. We finished up and paid on the ziosk because we hadn't even seen the waitress in a good 10 minutes. The gentlemen behind us was complaining he hadn't seen her either. Unfortunately I needed a box and had to wait. After about 10 minutes we asked a random server for a box and finally our waitress comes over and ask if we wanted our check. We told her we were all set and she just said have a good night and walked away. The other server came back and brought the box and we finally left. Normally I don't complain but it's just a matter of getting an attentive server or not and unfortunately she was not that attentive to us. Still love red robin though and the food was delicious!!

This place is underwhelming but they have a lot of burger options. Chicken too. My mom and I got an app... 6 onion rings for $5. Her burger was $14 and my chicken sandwich was $13. Wayyyy overpriced for the quality of food...also since it's a chain.  Our waiter was okay and food came out fast. My mom didn't like the peach tea she ordered and had to send it back for another kind. My margarita was too sugary.  Meh. Bill was almost $50 with tip. Not worth it.

It's is very very cold here. I've asked several of the other patrons and we all agree: IT'S FREEZING!!! I asked the manager and she simply brushed it off with, "well, the temp is on 70" and walked away. I wish that I had gone someplace else with my family for dinner. (Please note that the weather channel says its 67 degree outside now. There is absolutely no need for a/c to be on so high).
I have given this place more chances and have learned to like it. My kids love it this place and make me go anytime they are in the area. Burgers are great and the endless fries are awesome.

If my review were based solely on the food this would be a solid four stars.  But, $40 for 2 burgers and 2 beers is, in my opinion, simply outrageous.  As is the added surcharge for the use of the computer tablet at the table.  $2 conveniently added on for the luxury of accidentally swiping an app that we never even used?  Let me back up.  Each table at this location (not sure if this is throughout the chain or not, because this was the first and last time I've ever dined at Red Robin) comes equipped with a computer tablet complete with the full menu AND an assortment of games.  So, first of all, we've now replaced human interaction at a meal with technology.  That's bad enough.  At least some of the games are interactive.  But, to add insult to injury, the games are NOT free!  I understand that the tablets are expensive but somehow I think that the cost of same could be incorporated into the price of my [alreadywayoverpriced] $12 burger.  Come on corporate, get your priorities in order.  Bad enough that you have to pay for the games, but it's not even really clear that you do.  There's no visible warning.  Basically it was one quick pop up that was easily missed and the use of the word "premium" to differentiate the games from the menu items.  So, you can look at the menu items on the tablet for free but if you accidentally open a game, $2 is automatically added to your bill.  If you're already going beat me up for the price of my burger, at the very least, please be clear that you're going to charge me to use your computer tablet.  We explained to the waitress that we didn't play the game and she gave us a very rehearsed "oh my I have no idea why that was added to your bill" statement, I'll get that removed."  So, for all the people who don't notice, Red Robin is raking in the profits.  Start replacing greed with good will and maybe I'll be back.  Until then, I wish everyone in America would boycott the establishment based on principle alone.

Food was ok, servers rely a bit too much in the little electronic tabletop "ziosk" which left us sitting trying to wave anyone down for far too long.  Not a spectacular experience. Will likely not return to this location.

This was a first time for me at a Red Robin restaurant. I was not sure what to expect and was pleasantly surprised.  We arrived with a large group of 15 without reservation. They seated us quickly. The children grabbed all the balloons they had available.  The menu is primarily burgers, but with our group that was fine.  The server for the night was exceptional with such a huge group. He got all the drink and food orders correctly. He divided up the bills between family groups even though we were dispersed  unevenly. One patron in our group received cold french fries, not only did he replace the fries he brought three large baskets for the table to enjoy. That was going above and beyond in correcting the minor issue. The food was about what to expect with a chain burger restaurant. It was decent.  I was impressed with the service provided with such a large group.  If in the area again, I would gladly return.

Just had a great meal here. Only 1 complaint, burger was well done asked for medium, other than that though, it was a good experience. Our waitress was Amy, and she was pretty much on top of things. Will be back for sure.
The Food was great - bottomless fries and drinks were great ! We never been here before and came with a large group. We had a great time

So...my family and I are in Bartonsville,Pa shopping at the outlets and decided to go to Red Robin's restaurant.  This was our first time here.  Hubby ordered the Tavern burger with fries, one of our daughters ordered the 9 meatballs on breadsticks with broccoli, our other daughter ordered the mac and cheese with apples, and I ordered the Cobb salad.  My husband said his burger was ok, but the BBQ sauce tasted funky and he didn't care for it. My older girl tasted one meatball and decided it was not for her ( besides the fact that they looked dried out and over processed) She proceeded to eat the mini breadsticks and broccoli.  My lil one had a few bites of the mac n cheese and decided she was full.  Translation: no thank you! She ate the apples and a lot of my salad.  My salad was fine.  They call it a big salad and it was.  We had a nice waitress, but our family agrees it was not a place we will go again to any time soon.
Burger was burnt beyond edible wish I could post a pic.never going there again.....
I found a pair of decent Sony headphones in rhe parking lot. And the Pig Out Tavern Double is to DIE for

Friendly staff. Clean establishment. Tasty and not greasy burgers. Great fries and lemon aid with refills. Nice ambience. Love the kiosk to pay bills. Can override the 20 percent tip but unlikely you will.

Short and sweet  IF you want a fantastic burger ..this is the place . (A+)  I prefer another place for steaks and full meals  Great Bar .. Great service and Atmosphire (A)  Great location off of rte 80 .
My daughter has celiac and she was able to have a burger with a gluten free bun and gluten free fries!  Everything was delicious and our server was wonderful!  Wish we had a Red Robin in Vermont ...

We've been coming here since they opened but I have to say they have gone downhill the last year or so. Food has been hit or miss and service has been slow and inattentive. Had to wait 15 minutes for a second order of fries and burgers just aren't made as well , sloppy and stingy with the toppings. Everyone who ate with us had to use the bathroom immediately when we got home. I'm not sure what happened, we no longer want to go there anymore.

While on a family trip to the poconos we decided to stop in. My son took the grilled cheese and fries he really liked. My lady had the California salad that had basically no avocado and was not too fresh. I decided to have a Tuscan chicken sandwich and their garlic fries. Best was my IPA. Guess if you come here take a cheeseburger and fries and a nice tap beer!
